maml:description.maml:para: Clone a policy as a shared policy.

Clones the staging, production, and last modified versions of a shared or non-shared policy into a new shared policy. You can also specify any additional versions that you want to clone into the new policy as a comma-separated string. When cloning a non-shared policy to a shared policy, you need to provide the `-GroupID` parameter.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
The name of the new shared policy.
Unique identifier for each group.
Any additional versions that you want to clone into the new shared policy.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Any additional versions that you want to clone into the new shared policy.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
The name of the new shared policy.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Expand load balancer details.
This is an internal function used to retrieve Cloudlet Load Balancers and their versions more easily in other commands.
Unique identifier for the origin.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

Expand cloudlet policy details.
This is an internal function used to retrieve Cloudlet policies and their versions more easily in other commands.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Additional parameters.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Additional parameters.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Get a Cloudlet policy.
Gets all Cloudlets or returns a specific Cloudlet by its ID (v2-only). > Note: Without the `-Legacy` switch parameter, this command applies to version 3 of the Cloudlets API.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

For GET operations, returns only policies for this particular `cloudletId`. The `cloudletId` for Edge Redirector is `0`, Visitor Prioritization is `1`, Forward Rewrite is `3`, Request Control is `4`, API Prioritization is `5`, Audience Segmentation is `6`, Phased Release is `7` and Application Load Balancer is `9`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

For GET operations, returns only policies for this particular `cloudletId`. The `cloudletId` for Edge Redirector is `0`, Visitor Prioritization is `1`, Forward Rewrite is `3`, Request Control is `4`, API Prioritization is `5`, Audience Segmentation is `6`, Phased Release is `7` and Application Load Balancer is `9`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get a group.
Gets information about the Cloudlet types associated with the selected group. To display the results, you need to have edit permissions for one or more Cloudlet types within the group.
Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Unique identifier for each group.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Get a conditional origin.

Gets all Cloudlet Load Balancers (Conditional Origins) or returns a specific record by its origin ID. When listing all, you can limit the results to either `APPLICATION_LOAD_BALANCER`, `CUSTOMER`, or `NETSTORAGE` within the `-Type` parameter.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for the origin.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Returns data for a specific type of origin as defined in Property Manager. Options include alb for Application Load Balancer origins, customer for standard origins, and netstorage for NetStorage-based origins.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for the origin.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Returns data for a specific type of origin as defined in Property Manager. Options include alb for Application Load Balancer origins, customer for standard origins, and netstorage for NetStorage-based origins.
Get activations for a load balancing configuration.
Gets all Cloudlet Load Balancer activations in your account. You can also limit the results to a given Load Balancer by its origin ID.
Unique identifier for the origin.

Get a load balancing version.
Gets all versions of a given Load Balancer by its origin ID or returns a specific version. The `-Version` parameter is an integer or the word `latest`.
Unique identifier for the origin.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

Get a policy.

Gets all Cloudlet policies or returns a specific policy by its ID. When listing all policies, you can control paging with the `-Page` and `-Size` parameters. When listing v2 policies, you can additionally limit them by group ID or Cloudlet ID and include deleted policies with the `-IncludeDeleted` parameter.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Following paging links until exhausted, returning all policies.

For GET operations, returns only policies for this particular `cloudletId`. The `cloudletId` for Edge Redirector is `0`, Visitor Prioritization is `1`, Forward Rewrite is `3`, Request Control is `4`, API Prioritization is `5`, Audience Segmentation is `6`, Phased Release is `7` and Application Load Balancer is `9`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
For GET operations, includes deleted policies in the results.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Specifies a page number for batched results, starting at zero.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Specifies the number of objects on a page, at least `10` objects if using Shared. Otherwise the minimum is 1.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Following paging links until exhausted, returning all policies.

For GET operations, returns only policies for this particular `cloudletId`. The `cloudletId` for Edge Redirector is `0`, Visitor Prioritization is `1`, Forward Rewrite is `3`, Request Control is `4`, API Prioritization is `5`, Audience Segmentation is `6`, Phased Release is `7` and Application Load Balancer is `9`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
For GET operations, includes deleted policies in the results.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Specifies a page number for batched results, starting at zero.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Specifies the number of objects on a page, at least `10` objects if using Shared. Otherwise the minimum is 1.
Get status for an activation.

Gets all policy activations or returns a specific activation by its ID. Use the `-Legacy` switch to specify v2 policies (both when listing policies or retrieving a single policy); otherwise, the command will apply only to v3 (shared) policies. When listing all activations, you can control paging with the `-Page` and `-Size` parameters. When listing v2 policy activations, you can additionally filter them by network and property name.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Identifies the policy activation.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Returns only activations for the selected network, either `staging` or `prod`. Note, this has no effect for Shared policies.
Specifies a page number for batched results, starting at zero.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
Returns only activations for the selected property. Note, this has no effect for Shared policies.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Specifies the number of objects on a page, at least `10` objects if using Shared. Otherwise the minimum is 1.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Identifies the policy activation.

Specifies the number of objects on a page, at least `10` objects if using Shared. Otherwise the minimum is 1.

Get a policy version.

Gets all versions of a given Cloudlet policy or returns a specific policy version. The `-Version` parameter is an integer or the word `latest`. Use the `-Legacy` switch to specify v2 policies; otherwise, the command will apply only to v3 (shared) policies. When listing all versions, you can control paging with the `-Page` and `-Size` parameters as well as include the Cloudlet rules in the version response with the `-IncludeRules` switch parameter. When retrieving a specific version of a v2 policy, you can also optionally omit its rules from the output with the `-OmitRules` switch parameter.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Excludes the match rules from the results.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Specifies a page number for batched results, starting at zero.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.

EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Excludes the match rules from the results.
Specifies a page number for batched results, starting at zero.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Specifies the number of objects on a page, at least `10` objects if using Shared. Otherwise the minimum is 1.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

Gets information for a specific rule within a policy version. > Note: This command applies only to v2 policies.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
The ID of the rule within the policy version.

Get associated properties.
Gets the complete list of Cloudlet-associated properties. > Note: This command applies only to v2 policies.

Get a schema.

Gets all Cloudlet schemas or returns a specific schema by its Cloudlet type. The `-CloudletType` parameter is translated automatically from the product name (for example, `Phased Release`) to its API-specific type code (for example, `CD`).
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The name of the cloudlet type, e.g. Phased Release. This is translated to the correct 2- or 3-letter code automatically.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

The name of the JSON schema file. JSON schema filenames include; create-policy.json, update-policy.json, clone-policy.json, create-nimbus_policy_version-{cloudletCode}-1.0.json, update-nimbus_policy_version-{cloudletCode}-1.0.json, and match_rule-{cloudletCode}-1.0.json. The value for cloudletCode is either ALB, AP, AS, CD, ER, FR, IG, or VP.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
The name of the cloudlet type, e.g. Phased Release. This is translated to the correct 2- or 3-letter code automatically.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

The name of the JSON schema file. JSON schema filenames include; create-policy.json, update-policy.json, clone-policy.json, create-nimbus_policy_version-{cloudletCode}-1.0.json, update-nimbus_policy_version-{cloudletCode}-1.0.json, and match_rule-{cloudletCode}-1.0.json. The value for cloudletCode is either ALB, AP, AS, CD, ER, FR, IG, or VP.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Create a load balancing configuration.
Creates a new Cloudlet load balancing configuration. You can specify the name with the `-OriginID` parameter. Optionally, you can add the `-Description` parameter.

Activate a load balancing version.
Activates the selected load balancing version. The `-Version` parameter is an integer or the word `latest`. You can also add the `-DryRun` parameter to simulate the request without activating.
Unique identifier for the origin.
Returns only activations for the selected network, either `staging` or `prod`. Note, this has no effect for Shared policies.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Include this switch for policy activations on multiple properties to reduce API response time and let the policy activation continue asynchronously in the background.
If `true`, the operation validates the configuration, but does not activate the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
Include this switch for policy activations on multiple properties to reduce API response time and let the policy activation continue asynchronously in the background.
If `true`, the operation validates the configuration, but does not activate the load balancing version. The default setting is `false`.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.

Unique identifier for the origin.

Create a policy.

Creates a new Cloudlet policy either as a v3 policy (shared) or a legacy policy enabled with the `-Legacy` switch. You need to specify the `-CloudletType` parameter as the full product name (for example, `Phased Release`). When creating a v2 policy, you also have the option of cloning an existing policy with the `-ClonePolicyId` and `-ClonePolicyVersion` parameters.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
ID of the policy to clone.
Version of the policy to clone.
The name of the cloudlet type, e.g. Phased Release. This is translated to the correct 2- or 3-letter code automatically.
Description to include.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Name of the policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
ID of the policy to clone.
Version of the policy to clone.
The name of the cloudlet type, e.g. Phased Release. This is translated to the correct 2- or 3-letter code automatically.
Description to include.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Unique identifier for each group.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Name of the policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Activate a policy version.

Activates a Cloudlet policy version. Use the `-Legacy` switch to specify v2 policies; otherwise, the command will apply only to v3 policies. When using v2 policies, you can also provide additional properties with the `-AdditionalPropertyNames` parameter. You can also specify multiple properties as a comma-separated string.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
An array of one or more additional properties that you want to activate with the Cloudlet policy. Once activated, the property and policy are permanently linked.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Returns only activations for the selected network, either `staging` or `prod`. Note, this has no effect for Shared policies.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.
An array of one or more additional properties that you want to activate with the Cloudlet policy. Once activated, the property and policy are permanently linked.
EdgeRC file to authenticate your command. Defaults to ~/.edgerc.
Indicate that your policy is legacy (v2). Without this v3 of the Cloudlets API will be used.
Returns only activations for the selected network, either `staging` or `prod`. Note, this has no effect for Shared policies.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
EdgeRC section to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to 'default'.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.

Account Switch Key, for use when you have access to mulitple accounts and need to specify which one to use. Account Switch Keys can be found using Get-AccountSwitchKey.

Add a version rule.
Adds a new rule to an existing policy version. You can add only one rule at a time. > Note: This command applies only to v2 policies.
The ID of the cloudlet policy.
Version number. Can be an integer or the word 'latest'.
Request body, either as a PSCustomObject or string. This parameter supports pipelining.

The order within the current list of rules where you want to add the new rule. If you do not set this parameter, the new rule is added to the end of the current rule list. For Cloudlets, the first rule listed is the first rule evaluated.

Remove a policy.
Deletes an existing Cloudlet policy by its ID. You can't delete a policy if any of its versions is active or being activated on the staging or production networks.

Update a policy.

Updates an existing policy. Use the `-Legacy` switch to specify v2 policies; otherwise, this command will apply only to v3 policies. For both types of policies, you can update the policy's description and move it to a new group by its ID. For v2 policies, you can also update the policy's name.
